title: Government of Gauteng
text:
The government of <a href="Gauteng">Gauteng</a> province in South Africa consists of a <a href="unicameral">unicameral</a> <a href="Gauteng%20Provincial%20Legislature">legislature</a> elected by <a href="proportional%20representation">proportional representation</a>, and an executive branch headed by a <a href="Premier%20of%20Gauteng">Premier</a> who is elected by the legislature.
Legislature.
The provincial legislature is a unicameral body of 73 members elected by a system of <a href="party-list%20proportional%20representation">party-list proportional representation</a>. The legislature is elected for a term of five years, unless it is dissolved early. By convention elections to the provincial legislature are held at the same time as elections to the <a href="National%20Assembly%20of%20South%20Africa">National Assembly</a>. The legislature meets in the <a href="Johannesburg%20City%20Hall">Johannesburg City Hall</a>.
The most recent elections were held <a href="South%20African%20general%20election%2C%202019">on 8 May 2019</a>, and were won by the <a href="African%20National%20Congress">African National Congress</a> (ANC) which obtained 37 of the 73 seats on the legislature. The composition of the legislature is as follows:
!colspan="2" style="text-align:left"| Party !! style="text-align:center"| Seats 
Executive.
The head of the provincial executive is the <a href="Premier%20of%20Gauteng">Premier of Gauteng</a>, who is a member of the provincial legislature elected by the legislature. The Premier appoints an <a href="Executive%20Council%20%28South%20Africa%29">Executive Council</a> who are a <a href="cabinet%20%28government%29">cabinet</a> overseeing the executive <a href="government%20department">departments</a>.
 the Premier is <a href="David%20Makhura">David Makhura</a> of the ANC, and the ten members of the Executive Council are described in the following table.
Courts.
South Africa has a single national court system and the provinces do not have their own courts. The <a href="Gauteng%20Division">Gauteng Division</a> of the <a href="High%20Court%20of%20South%20Africa">High Court of South Africa</a>, which has seats in <a href="Pretoria">Pretoria</a> and <a href="Johannesburg">Johannesburg</a>, has jurisdiction over all cases arising in the province. However, most cases are first heard in one of the over 25 district <a href="magistrate%27s%20court%20%28South%20Africa%29">magistrates' courts</a> or in the regional magistrate's court for the province. Appeals from the magistrates' courts are to the High Court, and appeals from the High Court are to the <a href="Supreme%20Court%20of%20Appeal%20of%20South%20Africa">Supreme Court of Appeal</a> or the <a href="Constitutional%20Court%20of%20South%20Africa">Constitutional Court</a>.
Administrative divisions.
Gauteng is divided into three <a href="metropolitan%20municipality%20%28South%20Africa%29">metropolitan municipalities</a> and two <a href="district%20municipality%20%28South%20Africa%29">district municipalities</a>. The district municipalities are in turn divided into a total of seven <a href="local%20municipality%20%28South%20Africa%29">local municipalities</a>. These municipalities are:
